meaningMnemonic: You're taking <kanji>reality</kanji> and trying to <kanji>resemble</kanji> it. To do this, you have to do an <vocabulary>imitation</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>mimicry</vocabulary>, or an <vocabulary>impersonation</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
This word uses the kun'yomi reading for 真 and an irregular reading for 似. You've already learned the reading for 真, but here's a mnemonic to help you with 似:

What are you doing an <vocabulary>imitation</vocabulary> of? A horse! You gallop around <reading>neigh</reading>ing (ね) at the top of your lungs! That's a pretty good imitation.
